statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -17 \\ -2 \\ 11 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 12 \\ -3 \\ -15 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -5 \\ -5 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 4 \\ -1 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -17 \\ -2 \\ 11 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 12 \\ -3 \\ -15 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
